name: Palihouse Santa Monica

reviews.text: I can't fault much about this place. The Swedish lady in reception was efficient and helpful. The room was cleaned daily to a great standard. The place is older but everything works and if anything it adds to the charm of it. The place was serenely quiet but it was easy to walk to the livelier parts of Santa Monica. The lack of parking was not too much of a problem as a street permit is supplied. The apartment style suited our traveling needs. There was a reasonably well equipped kitchen and eating in saved a fortune as the restaurants in Santa Monica were not great value.
reviews.title: Nice place and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel hidden two blocks away from the epicenter of Santa Monica (and the beach) in a quiet residential neighborhood. A small hotel, classically aged, with a European feel. Beautiful gardens in front and back. Would highly recommend. Limited services, but everything you need is close by. What a refreshing change from chain hotels. Go for it!
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.text: We were not impressed! It cost us more than staying at a major chain, yet had fewer amenities. We have stayed at many hotel apartments in Canada, Europe and the U.S. and this was the least pleasing. The room we stayed in had an unpleasant odour. We had a view of the recycling and garbage bins on one side of the room. We could not sleep due to the noise from outside. The cooking utensils were very old and the non-stick cookware was scratched beyond recognition. The large and small appliances are very old. Staff is not available from 8:00p.m. to 8:00 a.m. so if you are traveling with children, this could pose an issue in case you need someone in the middle of the night. Finding a parking spot was always an issue. The laundry room was located in the basement which was poorly lit and only available in the evening for a few hours. If we had not pre-paid for four nights, we would have left on the first day!
reviews.title: Could have been better for the price we paid

reviews.text: The first 4 days of our spring break were spent at a full service hotel. So, when we got to Santa Monica to stay in an 'apartment hotel' it was a bit of a jolt. The Embassy Hotel was built in the 1930's and is an older facility. It is not plush, but it has lots of room and character. There is no room service, a strange contraption for an elevator, and only street parking which can be elusive. The place really grew on us. We stayed for 3 nights and really fell in love with the place. You can't beat the location- 2 blocks from 3rd street promenade, or, the value for the space.
reviews.title: Not what I expected...but it really grew on me, very charming!

reviews.text: Our apartment was genuinely self-contained, unlike many others that say they are, but offer sparse facilities. We stayed in a two bedroom apartment for four nights, and would happily stay here again. The apartment was over two levels, and was spacious and clean. The hotel has a lovely Spanish feel, and is only a short stroll to the Promenade and the Pier. The management were terrific, helping with everything from tour bookings, to transport, to hair appointments. Their helpfulness completed a great stay.
reviews.title: A terrific place to stay.

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel and were immediately struck on the beauty and character of this Lobby. Check in was easy and we were given a Parking permit which gives free parking in the street and surrounding blocks. The apartment itself was very large and spacious , it had a lovely kitchen with all the equipment you could wish for. The furniture in the apartment sympathetic to the building very art deco . The apartment had a large sitting room with two large sofas ( one of which was a sofa bed). There was also a large dining table with six chairs. There was a little dressing table area and a master bedroom with two huge walk in closets . The apartment was very clean and tidy, and the maids really did an excellent job. There were two tv's one in the bedroom and a large plasma tv in the living room. The apartments are ideally places only 3 blocks from the sea and about two blocks from the main shopping are all within walking distance. There is a Whole food store nearby for food shopping which although a bit expensive because all the produce is organic is very good.
reviews.title: Loved this beautiful character property would book a return visit
great place, frienly staff
reviews.text: The apartments have laundry facilities too. It is an excellent base to explore all the area and is only about 15 minutes away from downtown LA and holywood.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: spacious rooms, elegant atmosphere, central location on third street, convenient parking
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: We stayed at the Embassy Apartments for 2 weeks as a base for visiting husband's family. We had a very large studio apartment on the first floor (second floor to Americans) overlooking the garden. The studio was very spacious with a nice little dressing table area off the main room. The kitchen was well equipped and we made good use of it, eating breakfast in every morning and also the occasional dinner. The furniture was old and comfortable and in keeping with the atmosphere of the place. The bed was king size and very comfortable. Lots of cupboard space. The bathroom was adequate with a good shower.
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maid service every day was good and we always came back to a well cleaned apartment.
reviews.title: great spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found this hotel on trip advisor and pleasantly surprised. It is tucked out of the way, but is only a 10 minute walk from the 3rd Street Promenade. The hotel has a charming feel and the garden is very nice. The rooms are small but comfortable. The only real issue was the bathroom which was unfeasibly small.
reviews.title: A

reviews.text: From the road Embassy oozes old Spanish charm with beautiful cared for gardens.The inside is old but comfortable. We had a 2 brm apartment which was very roomy. It is in a good location ..a couple of blocks from beach and shops. Friendly staff . Would recommend.
reviews.title: Great place old style charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: turned up meet the house keeper as happy as a pigeon with a broken arm
reviews.title: these people are rude / this sums it up ( CLOWNS )

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: over priced / bed rubbish/ facilities nill / dont stay her save ya money these people dont diserve your hard earned cash
reviews.title: Superb find, thank you Trip Advisor.
A breath of fresh air
reviews.text: We were coming to the end of a fabulous road trip,taking in Las Vegas, San Fransisco and San Diego. We needed our last 3 days to be slightly more restful than the previous 2 weeks had been. Before we left San Diego, we checked out a few suggestions from Trip Advisor, for Venice and Santa Monica. We viewed a couple of places towards the beach and found them to be totally overpriced and, one in particular, challenged in the hygiene department! So we decided to explore further in a couple of blocks and discovered the Embassy. From the roadside, the building is impressive. The architecture is stunning and it is obvious from the well tended gardens and highly maintained exterior, that this place is looked after by people who care deeply for this beautiful property. As soon as you enter, a feeling of serenity wraps itself around you. It is tranquil, cool and transports you to a by-gone era. Josh welcomed us and offered no objection when we asked to see the room. I knew before we even opened the door that it was going to suit us perfectly. We occupied a 1 bedroomed suite which was huge. In the hands of a "chain", the space would have housed at least 6 guests. It was well equipped and furnished with good quality, aged, furniture; and the linen was top quality. The room rate was extremely reasonable, compared to the previous places we had viewed. All in all, a thoroughly good find, of which I would not hesitate to recommend to fellow travelers. It is situated 2 blocks from the beach and just as close to all the shops and restaurants, whilst nestling in a quiet residential area. A huge bonus is the free parking. Every other hotel we looked at insisted on valet parking, at $24 per day! Josh and his team were so helpful and friendly, offering us really good local information.

I had almost all of our out of town wedding guests choose to stay here with us and everyone loved it. The rooms are classic and stylish, well taken care of, and the whole hotel has a luxury feel with real history. My aunt even whipped out the words "charming."
reviews.title: Great Wedding Hotel for Friends and Family

reviews.text: It made for a perfectly intimate setting, plus has a great location just a few blocks from the promenade and Ocean. The staff was great as well, relaxed and so friendly! We had guests to our room on two occasions and we used the court yard for coffee and pastries on Sunday for a send off.
reviews.title: Great place, great staff and great location!

reviews.text: My wife, son and I recently stayed at the Embassy for 3 months whilst I was working in LA. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment which has a self contained kitchen, generous size living room and large bedroom. We chose to stay at the Embassy for the type of room on offer but also because of its proximity to local attactions, restaurants and amenities. The Embassy truly is a wonderful place to stay. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, the staff go out of their way to help you and it is in a perfect location for such a reasonable rate. The only thing I need to note for other travellers is that it is not really disabled/young child friendly as there are about 10 stairs to get to the elevator and then you have to open the doors manually which was quite a challenge for my wife when she was taking our son out in his pram by herself.
reviews.title: Comfortable, peaceful, great location ... parking tricky!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I return to LA I will be staying at the Embassy!
reviews.title: OUTSTANDING VALUE - Can't wait to come back

reviews.text: My wife and I and our two young kids stayed here in April 2011, and loved this "hotel". We had a beautiful suite overlooking the garden, with plenty of space in the family room for toys and clothes and a fold out bed for our three year old son. The room was impeccably clean and very large for the four of us, and the little kitchen was great for breakfast and lunch ... and would be fine for dinner too. The location is brilliant, just two blocks from the start of the mall and all of the shopping cafes and restaurants.
reviews.title: Great location for Santa Monica visit

description: Palihouse Santa Monica is a boutique beach lodge offering 38 generously appointed classic rooms as well as stunning studios, one and two-bedroom guest suites featuring fully equipped kitchens. In continuous operation since 1927, Palihouse Santa Monica (formerly The Embassy Hotel Apartments) is an outstanding example of Moorish-influenced Mediterranean Revival Architecture. The building has been meticulously maintained and remains renowned for its elegant exterior ornamentation, lush courtyards and gracious lobby. Located in a quiet residential neighborhood, Palihouse Santa Monica is only a few minutes walk from some of Santa Monica's most famous attractions including the Third Street Promenade, Farmer's Market and the Santa Monica Pier
